properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Application Container.

properties.name: manifest_file
properties.description: • manifest_file - (Optional) The json manifest file containing the attributes related to launching an application. Use either manifest_file or manifest_attributes when specifying launch information.

properties.name: manifest
properties.description: • manifest - (Optional) The manifest attributes related to launching an application. Use either manifest_file or manifest when specifying launch information. Manifest attributes is documented below.

properties.name: deployment_file
properties.description: • deployment_file - (Optional) The json deployment file containing the attributes related to deploying an application. Use either deployment_file or deployment_attributes when specifying deployment information.

properties.name: deployment
properties.description: • deployment - (Optional) The deployment attributes related to deploying an application. Use either deployment_file or deployment when specifying deployment information. Deployment attributes is documented below.

properties.name: archive_url
properties.description: • archive_url - (Optional) Location of the application archive file in Oracle Storage Cloud Service, in the format app-name/file-name.

properties.name: auth_type
properties.description: • auth_type - (Optional) Uses Oracle Identity Cloud Service to control who can access your Java SE 7 or 8, Node.js, or PHP application. Allowed values are basic and oauth.

properties.name: availability_domain
properties.description: • availability_domain - (Optional) A list of one or more datacenter locations in the OCI region. Required on OCI.

properties.name: git_repository
properties.description: • git_repository - (Optional) The URL of the git repository to use the application container.

properties.name: git_username
properties.description: • git_username - (Optional) The username of a user with access to the git respository if the repository is private.

properties.name: git_password
properties.description: • git_password - (Optional) The password for the user with access to the git repository if the repository is private.

properties.name: load_balancer_subnets
properties.description: • load_balancer_subnets - (Optional) Two load balancer subnets. Required on OCI.

properties.name: notes
properties.description: • notes - (Optional) Comments about the application deployment.

properties.name: notification_email
properties.description: • notification_email - (Optional) Email address to which application deployment status updates are sent.

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) The name of the region where the application container will be deployed. Required on OCI.

properties.name: repository
properties.description: • repository (Optional) Repository of the application. The only allowed value is 'dockerhub'.

properties.name: runtime
properties.description: • runtime - (Optional) The allowed runtime environment variables. The allowed variables are java, node, php, python, golang, dotnet, or ruby. The default is java.

properties.name: subscription_type
properties.description: • subscription_type - (Optional) Whether the subscription type is hourly or monthly. The default is hourly.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A map of tags for the application container.
Manifest attributes supports the following:

properties.name: runtime
properties.description: • runtime - (Optional) Details the availble runtime attributes. Runtime is documented below.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) Determines whether the application is public or private. The default is worker (private).

properties.name: command
properties.description: • command - (Optional) Launch command to execute after the application has been uploaded.

properties.name: release
properties.description: • release - (Optional) Details the release attributes of a specific build. Release is documented below.

properties.name: startup_time
properties.description: • startup_time - (Optional) The maximum time in seconds to wait for an application to start.

properties.name: shutdown_time
properties.description: • shutdown_time - (Optional) The maximum time in seconds to wait for an application to stop.

properties.name: notes
properties.description: • notes - (Optional) Comments about the launch configuration.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: • mode - (Optional) The restart mode for application instances when the application is restarted. The only allowed value is rolling.

properties.name: clustered
properties.description: • clustered - (Optional) Boolean for whether the application instances act as a cluster with failover capability.

properties.name: home
properties.description: • home - (Optional) The context root of the application.

properties.name: health_check_endpoint
properties.description: • health_check_endpoint - (Optional) The URL that the application uses for health checks.
Deployment attributes supports the following:

properties.name: memory
properties.description: • memory - (Optional) The amount of memory in gigabytes made available to the application. The default is 2G.

properties.name: instances
properties.description: • instances - (Optional) The number of application instances. The default is 2.

properties.name: notes
properties.description: • notes - (Optional) Comments about the deployment.

properties.name: environment
properties.description: • environment - (Optional) A map of environment variables used by the application.

properties.name: secure_environment
properties.description: • secure_environment - (Optional) A list of environment variables marked as secured on the user interface.

properties.name: java_system_properties
properties.description: • java_system_properties - (Optional) A map os java system properties used by the application.

properties.name: services
properties.description: • services - (Optional) Service bindings for connections to other Oracle Cloud services. Services is documented below.
Runtime supports the following:

properties.name: major_version
properties.description: (Required) The major version of the runtime environment.
Release supports the following:

properties.name: build
properties.description: • build - (Optional) The value for a specific build.

properties.name: commit
properties.description: • commit - (Optional) The value for a specific commit.

properties.name: version
properties.description: • version - (Optional) The value for a specific version.
Services supports the following:

properties.name: identifier
properties.description: • identifier - (Required) The value for the identifier

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The type of service. Allowed values are JAAS, DBAAS, MYSQLCS, OEHCS, OEHPCS, DHCS, caching.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the existing service.

properties.name: username
properties.description: • username - (Required) The username to connect to the service.

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Required) The password to connect to the service.
In addition to the above, the following values are exported:

properties.name: app_url
properties.description: • app_url - URL of the created application

properties.name: web_url
properties.description: • web_url - Web URL of the application
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Service Instance.

properties.name: edition
properties.description: • edition - (Required) Database edition for the service instance. Possible values are SE, EE, EE_HP, or EE_EP.

properties.name: level
properties.description: • level - (Required) Service level for the service instance. Possible values are BASIC or PAAS.

properties.name: shape
properties.description: • shape - (Required) Desired compute shape. Possible values are oc3, oc4, oc5, oc6, oc1m, oc2m, oc3m, or oc4m.

properties.name: subscription_type
properties.description: • subscription_type - (Required) Billing unit. Possible values are HOURLY or MONTHLY.

properties.name: version
properties.description: • version - (Required) Oracle Database software version; one of: 12.2.0.1, 12.1.0.2, or 11.2.0.4.

properties.name: vm_public_key
properties.description: • vm_public_key - (Required) Public key for the secure shell (SSH). This key will be used for authentication when connecting to the Database Cloud Service instance using an SSH client.

properties.name: database_configuration
properties.description: • database_configuration - (Required) Specifies the details on how to configure the database. Database configuration is documented below.

properties.name: default_access_rules
properties.description: • default_access_rules - (Optional) Specifies the details on which default access rules are enable or disabled. Default Access Rules are configured below.

properties.name: desired_state
properties.description: • desired_state - (Optional) Specifies the desired state of the service instance. Allowed values are start, stop, and restart.

properties.name: instantiate_from_backup
properties.description: • instantiate_from_backup - (Optional) Specify if the service instance's database should, after the instance is created, be replaced by a database stored in an existing cloud backup that was created using Oracle Database Backup Cloud Service. Instantiate from Backup is documented below.

properties.name: ip_network
properties.description: • ip_network - (Optional) This attribute is only applicable to accounts where regions are supported. The three-part name of an IP network to which the service instance is added. For example: /Compute-identity_domain/user/object

properties.name: ip_reservations
properties.description: • ip_reservations - (Optional) Groups one or more IP reservations in use on this service instance. This attribute is only applicable to accounts where regions are supported.

properties.name: backups
properties.description: • backups - (Optional) Provides Cloud Storage information for how to implement service instance backups. Backups is documented below

properties.name: bring_your_own_license
properties.description: • bring_your_own_license - (Optional) Specify if you want to use an existing perpetual license to Oracle Database to establish the right to use Oracle Database on the new instance. Default value is false.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the Service Instance.

properties.name: high_performance_storage
properties.description: • high_performance_storage - (Optional) Specifies whether the service instance will be provisioned with high performance storage. Default value is false.

properties.name: hybrid_disastery_recovery
properties.description: • hybrid_disastery_recovery - (Optional) Provides information about an Oracle Hybrid Disaster Recovery configuration. Hybrid Disaster Recovery is documented below.

properties.name: notification_email
properties.description: • notification_email - (Optional) The email address to send notifications around successful or unsuccessful completions of the instance-creation operation.

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) Specifies the location where the service instance is provisioned (only for accounts where regions are supported).

properties.name: standby
properties.description: • standby - (Optional) Specifies the configuration details of the standby database. This is only applicable in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Regions. failover_database and disaster_recovery inside the database_configuration block must be set to true. Standby is documented below.

properties.name: subnet
properties.description: • subnet - (Optional) Name of the subnet within the region where the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance is to be provisioned.
Database Configuration supports the following:

properties.name: admin_password
properties.description: • admin_password - (Required) Password for Oracle Database administrator users sys and system. The password must meet the following requirements: Starts with a letter. Is between 8 and 30 characters long. Contains letters, at least one number, and optionally, any number of these special characters: dollar sign $, pound sign #, and underscore _.

properties.name: usable_storage
properties.description: • usable_storage - (Required) Storage size for data (in GB). Minimum value is 15. Maximum value depends on the backup destination: if BOTH is specified, the maximum value is 1200; if OSS or NONE is specified, the maximum value is 2048.

properties.name: availability_domain
properties.description: • availability_domain - (Optional) Name of the availability domain within the region where the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance is to be provisioned.

properties.name: backup_destination
properties.description: • backup_destination - (Optional) Backup Destination. Possible values are BOTH, OSS, NONE.This defaults to NONE.

properties.name: backup_storage_volume_size
properties.description: • backup_storage_volume_size - (Optional) The size (in GB) for the backup storage volume.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: character_set - (Optional) Character Set for the Database Cloud Service Instance. Default value is AL32UTF8. Supported values are:

properties.name: AL32UTF8
properties.description: , AR8ADOS710, AR8ADOS720, AR8APTEC715, AR8ARABICMACS, AR8ASMO8X, AR8ISO8859P6, AR8MSWIN1256, AR8MUSSAD768, AR8NAFITHA711, AR8NAFITHA721, AR8SAKHR706, AR8SAKHR707, AZ8ISO8859P9E, BG8MSWIN, BG8PC437S, BLT8CP921, BLT8ISO8859P13, BLT8MSWIN1257, BLT8PC775, BN8BSCII, CDN8PC863, CEL8ISO8859P14, CL8ISO8859P5, CL8ISOIR111, CL8KOI8R, CL8KOI8U, CL8MACCYRILLICS, CL8MSWIN1251, EE8ISO8859P2, EE8MACCES, EE8MACCROATIANS, EE8MSWIN1250, EE8PC852, EL8DEC, EL8ISO8859P7, EL8MACGREEKS, EL8MSWIN1253, EL8PC437S, EL8PC851, EL8PC869, ET8MSWIN923, HU8ABMOD, HU8CWI2, IN8ISCII, IS8PC861, IW8ISO8859P8, IW8MACHEBREWS, IW8MSWIN1255, IW8PC1507, JA16EUC, JA16EUCTILDE, JA16SJIS, JA16SJISTILDE, JA16VMS, KO16KSC5601, KO16KSCCS, KO16MSWIN949, LA8ISO6937, LA8PASSPORT, LT8MSWIN921, LT8PC772, LT8PC774, LV8PC1117, LV8PC8LR, LV8RST104090, N8PC865, NE8ISO8859P10, NEE8ISO8859P4, RU8BESTA, RU8PC855, RU8PC866, SE8ISO8859P3, TH8MACTHAIS, TH8TISASCII, TR8DEC, TR8MACTURKISHS, TR8MSWIN1254, TR8PC857, US7ASCII, US8PC437, UTF8, VN8MSWIN1258, VN8VN3, WE8DEC, WE8DG, WE8ISO8859P1, WE8ISO8859P15, WE8ISO8859P9, WE8MACROMAN8S, WE8MSWIN1252, WE8NCR4970, WE8NEXTSTEP, WE8PC850, WE8PC858, WE8PC860, WE8ROMAN8, ZHS16CGB231280, ZHS16GBK, ZHT16BIG5, ZHT16CCDC, ZHT16DBT, ZHT16HKSCS, ZHT16MSWIN950, ZHT32EUC, ZHT32SOPS, ZHT32TRIS.

properties.name: data_storage_volume_size
properties.description: • data_storage_volume_size - (Optional) The size (in GB) for the data storage volume.

properties.name: disaster_recovery
properties.description: • disaster_recovery - (Optional) Specify if an Oracle Data Guard configuration is created using the Disaster Recovery option or the High Availability option. Default value is false.

properties.name: failover_database
properties.description: • failover_database - (Optional) Specify if an Oracle Data Guard configuration comprising a primary database and a standby database is created. Default value is false.

properties.name: golden_gate
properties.description: • golden_gate - (Optional) Specify if the database should be configured for use as the replication database of an Oracle GoldenGate Cloud Service instance. You cannot set goldenGate to true if either is_rac or failoverDatabase is set to true. Default value is false.

properties.name: is_rac
properties.description: • is_rac - (Optional) Specify if a cluster database using Oracle Real Application Clusters should be configured. Default value is false.

properties.name: national_character_set
properties.description: • national_character_set - (Optional) National Character Set for the Database Cloud Service instance. Valid values are AL16UTF16 and UTF8.

properties.name: pdb_name
properties.description: • pdb_name - (Optional) This attribute is valid when Database Cloud Service instance is configured with version 12c. Pluggable Database Name for the Database Cloud Service instance. Default value is pdb1.

properties.name: sid
properties.description: • sid - (Optional) Database Name for the Database Cloud Service instance. Default value is ORCL.

properties.name: source_service_name
properties.description: • source_service_name - (Optional) Indicates that the service instance should be created as a "snapshot clone" of another service instance. Provide the name of the existing service instance whose snapshot is to be used.

properties.name: snapshot_name
properties.description: • snapshot_name - (Optional) The name of the snapshot of the service instance specified by sourceServiceName that is to be used to create a "snapshot clone". This parameter is valid only if source_service_name is specified.

properties.name: timezone
properties.description: • timezone - (Optional) Time Zone for the Database Cloud Service instance. Default value is UTC.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) Component type to which the set of parameters applies. Defaults to db

properties.name: db_demo
properties.description: • db_demo - (Optional) Indicates whether to include the Demos PDB.
Default Access Rules supports the following:

properties.name: enable_ssh
properties.description: • enable_ssh - (Optional) Indicates whether to enable the ssh access rule.

properties.name: enable_http
properties.description: • enable_http - (Optional) Indicates whether to enable the http access rule. This is only configurable with a single instance.

properties.name: enable_https
properties.description: • enable_https - (Optional) Indiciates whether to enable the http with ssl access rule. This is only configurable with a single instance.

properties.name: enable_db_console
properties.description: • enable_db_console - (Optional) Indicates whether to enable the db console access rule. This is only configurable with a single instance.

properties.name: enable_db_express
properties.description: • enable_db_express - (Optional) Indicates whether to enable the db express access rule. This is only configurable with a single instance.

properties.name: enable_db_listener
properties.description: • enable_db_listener - (Optional) Indicates whether to enable the db listener access rule. This is only configurable with a single instance

properties.name: enable_em_console
properties.description: • enable_em_console - (Optional) Indicates whether to enable the em console access rule. This is only configurable with a RAC instance.

properties.name: enable_rac_db_listener
properties.description: • enable_rac_db_listener - (Optional) Indicates whether to enable the rac db listene access rule. This is only configurable with a RAC instance

properties.name: enable_scan_listener
properties.description: • enable_scan_listener - (Optional) Indicates whether to enable the scan listener access rule. This is only configurable with a RAC instance

properties.name: enable_rac_ons
properties.description: • enable_rac_ons - (Optional) Indicates whether to enable the rac ons access rule. This is only configurable with a RAC instance.
Standby supports the following:

properties.name: availability_domain
properties.description: • availability_domain - (Required) Name of the availability domain within the region where the standby database of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance is to be provisioned.

properties.name: subnet
properties.description: • subnet - (Required) Name of the subnet within the region where the standby database of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance is to be provisioned.
Instantiate from Backup supports the following:

properties.name: cloud_storage_container
properties.description: • cloud_storage_container - (Required) Name of the Oracle Storage Cloud Service container where the existing cloud backup is stored.

properties.name: cloud_storage_username
properties.description: • cloud_storage_username - (Required) Username of the Oracle Cloud user.

properties.name: cloud_storage_password
properties.description: • cloud_storage_password - (Required) Password of the Oracle Cloud user specified in ibkup_cloud_storage_user.

properties.name: database_id
properties.description: • database_id - (Required) Database id of the database from which the existing cloud backup was created.

properties.name: decryption_key
properties.description: • decryption_key - (Optional) Password used to create the existing, password-encrypted cloud backup. This password is used to decrypt the backup. Specify either ibkup_decryption_key or ibkup_wallet_file_content for decrypting the backup.

properties.name: on_premise
properties.description: • on_premise - (Optional) Specify if the existing cloud backup being used to replace the database is from an on-premises database or another Database Cloud Service instance. The default value is false.

properties.name: service_id
properties.description: • service_id - (Optional) Oracle Database Cloud Service instance name from which the database of new Oracle Database Cloud Service instance should be created. This value is required if on_premise is set to true.

properties.name: wallet_file_content
properties.description: • wallet_file_content - (Optional) String containing the xsd:base64Binary representation of the cloud backup's wallet file. This wallet is used to decrypt the backup. Specify either ibkup_decryption_key or ibkup_wallet_file_content for decrypting the backup.
Backups support the following:

properties.name: cloud_storage_container
properties.description: • cloud_storage_container - (Required) Name of the Oracle Storage Cloud Service container used to provide storage for your service instance backups. Use the following format to specify the container name: <storageservicename>-<storageidentitydomain>/<containername>

properties.name: cloud_storage_username
properties.description: • cloud_storage_username - (Required) Username for the Oracle Storage Cloud Service administrator.

properties.name: cloud_storage_password
properties.description: • cloud_storage_password - (Required) Password for the Oracle Storage Cloud Service administrator.

properties.name: create_if_missing
properties.description: • create_if_missing - (Optional) Specify if the given cloud_storage_container is to be created if it does not already exist. Default value is false.
Hybrid Disaster Recovery supports the following:

properties.name: cloud_storage_container
properties.description: • cloud_storage_container - (Required) Name of the Oracle Storage Cloud Service container where the backup from on-premise instance is stored. Use the following format to specify the container name: <storageservicename>-<storageidentitydomain>/<containername>

properties.name: cloud_storage_username
properties.description: • cloud_storage_username - (Required) Username for the Oracle Storage Cloud Service administrator.

properties.name: cloud_storage_password
properties.description: • cloud_storage_password - (Required) Password for the Oracle Storage Cloud Service administrator.
In addition to the above, the following values are exported:

properties.name: compute_site_name
properties.description: • compute_site_name - The Oracle Cloud location housing the service instance.

properties.name: dbaas_monitor_url
properties.description: • dbaas_monitor_url- The URL to use to connect to Oracle DBaaS Monitor on the service instance.

properties.name: em_url
properties.description: • em_url - The URL to use to connect to Enterprise Manager on the service instance.

properties.name: glassfish_url
properties.description: • glassfish_url - The URL to use to connect to the Oracle GlassFish Server Administration Console on the service instance.

properties.name: identity_domain
properties.description: • identity_domain - The identity domain housing the service instance.

properties.name: status
properties.description: • status - The status of the service instance.

properties.name: uri
properties.description: • uri - The Uniform Resource Identifier for the Service Instance
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Service Instance.

properties.name: ssh_public_key
properties.description: • ssh_public_key - (Required) The ssh key to connect to the java service instance.

properties.name: edition
properties.description: • edition - (Required) The edition for the service instance. Possible values are SE, EE, or SUITE.

properties.name: service_version
properties.description: • service_version - (Required) Oracle WebLogic Server software version. Valid values are: 12cRelease213, 12cRelease212, 12cR3, or 11gR1

properties.name: backups
properties.description: • backups - (Required) Provides Cloud Storage information for service instance backups. Backups is documented below

properties.name: metering_frequency
properties.description: • metering_frequency - (Optional) Billing unit. Possible values are HOURLY or MONTHLY. Default value is HOURLY.

properties.name: availability_domain
properties.description: • availability_domain - (Optional) Name of a data center location in the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure region that is specified in region. This is only available for OCI.

properties.name: snapshot_name
properties.description: • snapshot_name - (Optional) Name of the snapshot to clone from.

properties.name: source_service_name
properties.description: • source_service_name - (Optional) Name of the existing Oracle Java Cloud Service instance that has the snapshot from which you are creating a clone.

properties.name: subnet
properties.description: • subnet - (Optional) A subdivision of a cloud network that is set up in the data center as specified in availability_domain. This is only available for OCI.

properties.name: use_identity_service
properties.description: • use_identity_service - (Optional) Flag that specifies whether to use Oracle Identity Cloud Service (true) or the local WebLogic identity store (false) for user authentication and to maintain administrators, application users, groups and roles. The default value is false.

properties.name: weblogic_server
properties.description: • weblogic_server - (Required) The attributes required to create a WebLogic server alongside the java service instance. WebLogic Server is documented below.

properties.name: oracle_traffic_director
properties.description: • oracle_traffic_director - (Optional) The attributes required to create an Oracle Traffic Director (Load balancer). OTD is documented below.

properties.name: level
properties.description: • level - (Optional) Service level for the service instance. Possible values are BASIC or PAAS. Default value is PAAS.

properties.name: backup_destination
properties.description: • backup_destination - (Optional) Specifies whether to enable backups for this Oracle Java Cloud Service instance. Valid values are BOTH or NONE. Defaults to BOTH.

properties.name: desired_state
properties.description: • desired_state - (Optional) Specifies the desired state of the service instance. Allowed values are running or shutdown. The default is running.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Provides additional on the java service instance.

properties.name: enable_admin_console
properties.description: • enable_admin_console - (Optional) Flag that specifies whether to enable (true) or disable (false) the access rules that control external communication to the WebLogic Server Administration Console, Fusion Middleware Control, and Load Balancer Console.

properties.name: ip_network
properties.description: • ip_network - (Optional) The three-part name of a custom IP network to attach this service instance to. For example: /Compute-identity_domain/user/object.

properties.name: assign_public_ip
properties.description: • assign_public_ip - (Optional) Flag that specifies whether to assign (true) or not assign (false) public IP addresses to the nodes in your service instance. The default is true, which means any node added during service instance provisioning, or later added as part of a scaling operation, will have a public IP address assigned to it. This attribute is only applicable when provisioning an Oracle Java Cloud Service instance in a region on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Classic, and a custom IP network is specified in ip_network

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional) Name of the region where the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance is to be provisioned. This attribute is only applicable to accounts where regions are supported. A region name must be specified if you want to use ipReservations or ipNetwork.

properties.name: bring_your_own_license
properties.description: • bring_your_own_license - (Optional) Flag that specifies whether to apply an existing on-premises license for Oracle WebLogic Server (true) to the new Oracle Java Cloud Service instance you are provisioning. The default value is false.

properties.name: force_delete
properties.description: • force_delete - (Optional) Flag that specifies whether you want to force the removal of the service instance even if the database instance cannot be reached to delete the database schemas. Default value is true
Backups supports the following:

properties.name: cloud_storage_container
properties.description: • cloud_storage_container - (Required) Name of the Oracle Storage Cloud Service container used to provide storage for your service instance backups. Use the following format to specify the container name on OCI Object Storage https://swiftobjectstorage.<region>.oraclecloud.com/v1/<tenancy>/<bucketname> or for Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Classic user the format: <storageservicename>-<storageidentitydomain>/<containername>

properties.name: cloud_storage_username
properties.description: • cloud_storage_username - (Optional) Username for the Oracle Storage Cloud Service administrator. If left unspecified, the username for Oracle Public Cloud is used.

properties.name: cloud_storage_password
properties.description: • cloud_storage_password - (Optional) Password for the Oracle Storage Cloud Service administrator. If left unspecified, the password for Oracle Public Cloud is used.

properties.name: create_if_missing
properties.description: • create_if_missing - (Optional) Specify if the given cloud_storage_container is to be created if it does not already exist. Default value is false.

properties.name: use_oauth_for_storage
properties.description: • use_oauth_for_storage - (Optional) Flag that specifies whether to use the default OAuth protected object storage for instance backups.
WebLogic Server supports the following:

properties.name: database
properties.description: • database - (Required) Information about the database deployment on Oracle Database Cloud Service or Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. Database is documented below.

properties.name: shape
properties.description: • shape - (Required) Desired compute shape.

properties.name: admin
properties.description: • admin - (Required) Admin information for the WebLogic Server. Admin is documented below.

properties.name: application_database
properties.description: • application_database - (Optional) Details of Database Cloud Service database deployments that host application schemas. Multiple can be specified. Application Database is specified below.

properties.name: backup_volume_size
properties.description: • backup_volume_size - (Optional) Size of the backup volume for the service. The value must be a multiple of GBs. You can specify this value in bytes or GBs. If specified in GBs, use the following format: nG, where n specifies the number of GBs. For example, you can express 10 GBs as bytes or GBs. For example: 100000000000 or 10G. This value defaults to the system configured volume size.

properties.name: cluster_name
properties.description: • cluster_name - (Optional) - Specifies the name of the cluster that contains the Managed Servers for the service instance.

properties.name: cluster
properties.description: • cluster - (Optional) Details the properties about one or more clusters. Cluster is documented below.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: connect_string - (Optional) - Connection string for the database. The connection string must be entered using one of the following formats:

properties.name: //host-scan.networkdomain:1521/pdbname.networkdomain
properties.description: • For Oracle Cloud Infrastructure VM or Exadata DB systems 12c or later: //host-scan.networkdomain:1521/pdbname.networkdomain

properties.name: //host.networkdomain:1521/pdbname.networkdomain
properties.description: • For Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Bare Metal DB systems 12c or later: //host.networkdomain:1521/pdbname.networkdomain

properties.name: host:port:SID
properties.description: • For Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Classic: host:port:SID, host:port/serviceName.

properties.name: content_port
properties.description: • content_port - (Optional) - Port for accessing the deployed applications using HTTP. Default value is 8001.

properties.name: deployment_channel_port
properties.description: • deployment_channel_port - Port for accessing the Administration Server using WLST. Default value is 9001.

properties.name: domain
properties.description: • domain - (Optional) Information about the WebLogic domain. Domain is documented below.

properties.name: ip_reservations
properties.description: • ip_reservations - (Optional) A list of ip reservation names.

properties.name: load_balancer
properties.description: • load_balancer - (Optional) Information about the loadbalancer to attach to the java service instance. Load Balancer is specfied below.

properties.name: managed_servers
properties.description: • managed_servers - (Optional) Details information about the managed servers the java service instance will look after. Managed Servers is documented below.

properties.name: middleware_volume_size
properties.description: • middleware_volume_size - (Optional) Size of the middleware home disk volume for the service (/u01/app/oracle/middleware). The value must be a multiple of GBs. You can specify this value in bytes or GBs. If specified in GBs, use the following format: nG, where n specifies the number of GBs. For example, you can express 10 GBs as bytes or GBs. For example: 100000000000 or 10G. This value defaults to the system configured volume size.

properties.name: node_manager
properties.description: • node_manager - (Optional) Node Manager is a WebLogic Server utility that enables you to start, shut down, and restart Administration Server and Managed Server instances from a remote location. Node Manager is documented below.

properties.name: pdb_service_name
properties.description: • pdb_service_name - (Optional) Name of the pluggable database for Oracle Database 12c. The default value is the pluggable database name when the database was created.

properties.name: ports
properties.description: • ports - (Optional) A block of port specifications. Weblogic Server Ports are specified below.

properties.name: upper_stack_product_name
properties.description: • upper_stack_product_name - (Optional) The Oracle Fusion Middleware product installer to add to this Oracle Java Cloud Service instance. Valid values are ODI (Oracle Data Integrator) or WCP (Oracle WebCenter Portal)

properties.name: root_url
properties.description: • root_url - (Computed) The URL of the WebLogic Server Administration console.
OTD supports the following:

properties.name: admin
properties.description: • admin - (Required) Admin information for the Oracle Traffic Director. Admin is documented below.

properties.name: shape
properties.description: • shape - (Required) Desired compute shape.

properties.name: high_availability
properties.description: • high_availability - (Optional) Flag that specifies whether load balancer HA is enabled. This value defaults to false (that is, HA is not enabled).

properties.name: ip_reservations
properties.description: • ip_reservations - (Optional) A list of ip reservation names.

properties.name: listener
properties.description: • listener - (Optional) Specifies the type and number of the listener port. Listener is documented below.

properties.name: load_balancing_policy
properties.description: • load_balancing_policy - (Optional) Policy to use for routing requests to the load balancer. Valid policies include: least_connection_count, least_response_time, round_robin. The default value is least_connection_count.

properties.name: root_url
properties.description: • root_url - (Computed) The URL of the OTD console.
Database supports the following:

properties.name: username
properties.description: • username - (Required) Username for the database administrator.

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Required) Password for the database administrator.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Name of the database on the Database Cloud Service. For use with Oracle Database Cloud Service only, Not required when deploying with Oracle Cloud Infrastructure native VM, Bare Metal or Exadata Cloud Service instance, see connect_string.

properties.name: hostname
properties.description: • hostname - (Computed) The hostname for the database.
Admin supports the following:

properties.name: username
properties.description: • username - (Required) Username for the WebLogic Server or Oracle Traffic Director administrator.

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Required) Password for the WebLogic Server or Oracle Traffic Director administrator.

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Optional) Port for accessing the WebLogic Server or Oracle Traffic Director using HTTP. The default values are 7001 for WebLogic Server or 8989 for Oracle Traffic Director.

properties.name: secured_port
properties.description: • secured_port - (Optional) Secured Port for accessing the WebLogic Server. The default value is 7002.

properties.name: hostname
properties.description: • hostname - (Computed) The hostname for the admin server on the WebLogic Server or OTD.
Application Database supports the following:

properties.name: username
properties.description: • username - (Required) Username for the database administrator.

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Required) Password for the database administrator.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Name of the database deployment on the Database Cloud Service.

properties.name: pdb_name
properties.description: • pdb_name - (Optional) Name of the pluggable database for Oracle Database 12c. If not specified, the pluggable database name configured when the database was created will be used.
Cluster supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Name of the cluster to create.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) Type of cluster to create. Valid values are APPLICATION_CLUSTER or CACHING_CLUSTER

properties.name: server_count
properties.description: • server_count - (Optional) Number of servers to create in this cluster. The default value is 1.

properties.name: servers_per_node
properties.description: • servers_per_node - (Optional) Number of JVMs to start on each VM (node). The default value is 1.

properties.name: shape
properties.description: • shape - (Optional) Desired compute shape for the nodes in this cluster.

properties.name: path_prefixes
properties.description: • path_prefixes - (Optional) A single path prefix or multiple path prefixes separated by commas.
Domain supports the following:

properties.name: mode
properties.description: • mode - (Optional) Mode of the domain. Valid values are DEVELOPMENT or PRODUCTION. Default value is PRODUCTION.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Name of the WebLogic domain. By default, the domain name will be generated from the first eight characters of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance name (serviceName), using the following format: first8charsOfServiceInstanceName_domain.

properties.name: partition_count
properties.description: • partition_count - (Optional) Number of partitions to enable in the domain for WebLogic Server 12.2.1. Valid values include: 0 (no partitions), 1, 2, and 4.

properties.name: volume_size
properties.description: • volume_size - (Optional) Size of the domain volume for the service. The value must be a multiple of GBs. You can specify this value in bytes or GBs. If specified in GBs, use the following format: nG, where n specifies the number of GBs. For example, you can express 10 GBs as bytes or GBs. For example: 100000000000 or 10G.
Listener supports the following:

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Optional) Listener port for the load balancer for accessing deployed applications using HTTP. If left unspecified, applications on this service instance cannot be reached via http.

properties.name: secured_port
properties.description: • secured_port - (Optional) Secured listener port for the load balancer for accessing deployed applications using HTTPS.

properties.name: privileged_port
properties.description: • privileged_port - (Optional) Privileged listener port for accessing the deployed applications using HTTP.

properties.name: privileged_secured_port
properties.description: • privileged_secured_port - (Optional) Privileged listener port for accessing the deployed applications using HTTPS.
Managed Server supports the following:

properties.name: server_count
properties.description: • server_count - (Optional) Number of Managed Servers in the domain. Valid values include: 1, 2, 4, and 8. The default value is 1.

properties.name: initial_heap_size
properties.description: • initial_heap_size - (Optional) Initial Java heap size for a Managed Server JVM, specified in megabytes.

properties.name: max_heap_size
properties.description: • max_heap_size - (Optional) Maximum Java heap size for a Managed Server JVM, specified in megabytes.

properties.name: jvm_args
properties.description: • jvm_args - (Optional) One or more Managed Server JVM arguments separated by a space.

properties.name: initial_permanent_generation
properties.description: • initial_permanent_generation - (Optional) Initial Permanent Generation space in Java heap memory.

properties.name: max_permanent_generation
properties.description: • max_permanent_generation - (Optional) Maximum Permanent Generation space in Java heap memory.

properties.name: overwrite_jvm_args
properties.description: • overwrite_jvm_args - (Optional) Flag that determines whether the user defined Managed Server JVM arguments specified in msJvmArgs should replace the server start arguments (true), or append the server start arguments (false). Default is false.
Node Manager supports the following:

properties.name: username
properties.description: • username - (Optional) User name for the Node Manager. This value defaults to the WebLogic administrator user name.

properties.name: password
properties.description: • password - (Optional) Password for the Node Manager. This value defaults to the WebLogic administrator password.

properties.name: port
properties.description: • port - (Optional) Port for the Node Manager. This value defaults to 5556.
WebLogic Server Ports support the following:

properties.name: privileged_content_port
properties.description: • privileged_content_port - (Optional) Privileged content port for accessing the deployed applications using HTTP. To disable the privileged content port, set the value to 0. The default value is 80.

properties.name: priviliged_secured_content_port
properties.description: • priviliged_secured_content_port - (Optional) Privileged content port for accessing the deployed applications using HTTPS. To disable the privileged secured content port, set the value to 0. The default value is 443.

properties.name: deployment_channel_port
properties.description: • deployment_channel_port - (Optional) Port for accessing the WebLogic Administration Server using WLST. The default value is 9001.

properties.name: content_port
properties.description: • content_port - (Optional) Port for accessing the deployed applications using HTTP. The default value is 8001.
Load Balancer supports the following:

properties.name: load_balancing_policy
properties.description: • load_balancing_policy - (Optional) Policy to use for routing requests to the origin servers of the Oracle managed load balancer. Valid values are LEAST_CONN, IP_HASH, or ROUND_ROBIN.

properties.name: subnets
properties.description: • subnets - (Optional) A list of two OCI-managed load balancer ids.
In addition to the above, the following values are exported:

properties.name: status
properties.description: • status - The status of the service instance.

properties.name: uri
properties.description: • uri - The Uniform Resource Identifier for the Service Instance
For load_balancer the admin_url, console_url, and url are exported. (eg. load_balancer.0.url)
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required). The name of MySQL Cloud Service instance.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional). A description of the MySQL Instance

properties.name: ssh_public_key
properties.description: • ssh_public_key - (Required). The public key for the secure shell (SSH). This key wil be used for authentication when the user logs on to the instance over SSH.

properties.name: backup_destination
properties.description: • backup_destination - (Required) The destination where the database backups will be stored.

properties.name: shape
properties.description: • shape - (Required) The desired compute shape. A shape defines the number of Oracle Compute Units (OCPUs) and amount of memory (RAM). See About Shapes in Using Oracle Compute Cloud Service for more information about shapes.

properties.name: metering_frequency
properties.description: • metering_frequency - (Optional). The billing frequency of the service instance. Allowed values are MONTHLY and HOURLY

properties.name: region
properties.description: • region - (Optional). Specifies the region where the instance will be provisioned.

properties.name: availability_domain
properties.description: • availability_domain - (Optional) Name of the availability domain within the region where the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance is to be provisioned. This is applicable only if you wish to provision to an OCI instance.

properties.name: notification_email
properties.description: • notification_email - (Optional) The email address to send notifications around successful or unsuccessful completions of the instance-creation operation.

properties.name: ip_network
properties.description: • ip_network - (Optional) This attribute is only applicable to accounts where regions are supported. The three-part name of an IP network to which the service instance is added. For example: /Compute-identity_domain/user/object

properties.name: subnet
properties.description: • subnet -(Optional) This attribute is relevant to only Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. Specify the Oracle Cloud Identifier (OCID) of a subnet from a virtual cloud network (VCN) that you had created previously in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. For the instructions to create a VCN and subnet, see Prerequisites for Oracle Platform Services on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure in the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure documentation.

properties.name: vm_user
properties.description: • vm_user - (Optional) The user name of account to be created in the VM.

properties.name: backups
properties.description: • backups - (Optional) Provides Cloud Storage information for how to implement service instance backups. Backups is documented below

properties.name: mysql_configuration
properties.description: • mysql_configuration - (Required) Specified the detail of how to configure the MySQL database. mysql_configuration is documented below.
backups support the following :

properties.name: cloud_storage_container
properties.description: • cloud_storage_container - (Required). Name of the Oracle Storage Cloud container used for store the backups.

properties.name: cloud_storage_username
properties.description: • cloud_storage_username - (Required) Username for the Oracle Storage Cloud administrator.

properties.name: cloud_storage_password
properties.description: • cloud_storage_password - (Required) Password for the Oracle Storage Cloud administrator.

properties.name: create_if_missing
properties.description: • create_if_missing - (Optional) Specifies whether to create the container if it does not exist. Default value is false
mysql_configuration supports the following :

properties.name: db_name
properties.description: • db_name - (Optional). The name of the database instance. Default value is mydatabase

properties.name: db_storage
properties.description: • db_storage - (Optional). The storage volume sice for MySQL data. The value must be between 25 to 1024. Defaults to 25 (GB)

properties.name: mysql_charset
properties.description: • mysql_charset - (Optional) MySQL server character set. See Supported Character Sets and Collation. Default value is utf8mb4

properties.name: mysql_collation
properties.description: • mysql_collation -(Optional) MySQL server collation. See Supported Character Sets and Collation for the permissible collations of each character set.

properties.name: mysql_port
properties.description: • mysql_port - (Optional) The port number for the MySQL Server. The value must be between 3200-3399. Default value is 3306

properties.name: mysql_username
properties.description: • mysql_username - (Optional) The Administration user for connecting to the service via th MySQL protocol. Default value is root.

properties.name: mysql_password
properties.description: • mysql_password - (Optional) The password for the MySQL Administration user.

properties.name: source_service_name
properties.description: • source_service_name - (Optional) When present, indicates that the service instance should be created as a "snapshot clone" of another service instance. Provide the name of the existing service instance whose snapshot is to be used. db_name, mysql_charset, mysql_collation, enterpriseMonitor, and associated MySQL server component parameters do not apply when cloning a service from a snapshot. For those parameters, the clone operation uses the values defined in the snapshot of the source service instance.

properties.name: snapshot_name
properties.description: • snapshot_name - (Optional) The name of the snapshot of the service instance specified by source_service_name that is to be used to create a "snapshot clone". This parameter is valid only if source_service_name is specified.

properties.name: enterprise_monitor_configuration
properties.description: • enterprise_monitor_configuration - (Optional) Provides the Enterprise Monitor configuration for the MySQL Instance. If this is omitted, there will be no EM created for the MySQL Instance. enterprise_monitor_configuration is documented below.
enterprise_monitor_configuration supports the following :

properties.name: em_agent_username
properties.description: • em_agent_username - (Optional). Name for the Enterprise Monitor agent user.

properties.name: em_agent_password
properties.description: • em_agent_password - (Optional). Password for MySQL Enterprise Monitor agent.

properties.name: em_username
properties.description: • em_username - (Optional) Name for the Enterprise Monitor Manager user.

properties.name: em_password
properties.description: • em_password - (Optional) Password for MySQL Enterprise Monitor manager.

properties.name: em_port
properties.description: • em_port - (Optional) The port number for the MySQL Enterprise Monitor instance. The default is 18443.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Access Rule

properties.name: service_instance_id
properties.description: • service_instance_id - (Required) The name of the database service instance to attach the access rule to

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Required) The description of the Access Rule

properties.name: ports
properties.description: • ports - (Required) The port or range of ports to allow traffic on

properties.name: source
properties.description: • source - (Required) The IP addresses and subnets from which traffic is allowed. Valid values are DB, PUBLIC-INTERNET, or a single IP address or comma-separated list of subnets (in CIDR format) or IPv4 addresses.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Determines whether the access rule is enabled. Default is true.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Access Rule

properties.name: service_instance_id
properties.description: • service_instance_id - (Required) The name of the java service instance to attach the access rule to

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Required) The description of the Access Rule

properties.name: ports
properties.description: • ports - (Required) The port or range of ports to allow traffic on

properties.name: destination
properties.description: • destination - (Required) Destination to which traffic is allowed. Valid values include WLS_ADMIN, WLS_ADMIN_SERVER, OTD_ADMIN_HOST, OTD

properties.name: source
properties.description: • source - (Required) The IP addresses and subnets from which traffic is allowed. Valid values include WLS_ADMIN, WLS_ADMIN_SERVER, WLS_MANAGED_SERVER, OTD_ADMIN_HOST, OTD, or a single IP address or comma-separated list of subnets (in CIDR format) or IPv4 addresses.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Determines whether the access rule is enabled. Default is true.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Optional) Specifies the communication protocol. Valid values are tcp or udp. Default is tcp.

properties.name: service_instance_id
properties.description: • service_instance_id - (Required) The name of MySQL instance to attach the access rule to.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Name of the rule.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Description of the rule.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: • protocol - (Optional) Communication protocol for the rule. For example, tcp.

properties.name: ports
properties.description: • ports - (Required) Ports for the rule. This can be a single port or a port range.

properties.name: source
properties.description: • source - (Required) The hosts from which traffic is allowed. For example, PUBLIC-INTERNET for any host on the Internet, a single IP address or a comma-separated list of subnets (in CIDR format) or IPv4 addresses.

properties.name: destination
properties.description: • destination - (Required) The service component to allow traffic to. For example, mysql_MASTER.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Determines whether the access rule is enabled. Valid values are true and false. The Default is true.
